translation.en: -[Rachel] Very cool. -Mmm-hmm. -So is this an old haunt or… -No.
I haven't been here in years, actually,
translation.ko: 아뇨, 진짜 몇 년 만에 온 거예요

translation.en: but my mom used to take me here a lot when I was a kid.
translation.ko: 어릴 적 엄마 따라 자주 왔었죠

translation.en: -She loved this place. -I can see why. It's nice.
translation.ko: - 여길 좋아하셨어요 - 그럴 만해요, 분위기 좋네요

translation.en: -Welcome to Trattoria Toscana. -Thank you.
I am Vittorio. May I share tonight's specials?
translation.ko: 전 비토리오예요 오늘의 특선을 알려 드려요?

translation.en: [in English] Could you repeat in English?
No, no, it's… it's fine. I'll just have whatever she's having.
translation.ko: 아니, 괜찮아요 나도 같은 걸로 주세요

translation.en: -Ah. -Oh, and a glass of wine, please.
-Do you want one? -Uh, no, no.
You sure?
-[in English] What's that last thing? -Oh, it's, um…
-Separate checks. Yeah. -Separate checks?
You're a writer and I just want to respect that.
Both of my parents are artists. They make and sell their own jewelry.
translation.ko: 우리 부모님은 예술가예요 장신구를 직접 만들어서 파시죠

translation.en: So as you can imagine, it's, uh… there have been times when the bills have been challenging.
So I figure it's better to--
I'm sure you can understand and appreciate that sometimes it's--
translation.ko: 괜히 힘들게 제 몫까지 계산 안 하셔도…

translation.en: -Thank you. I appreciate it. Nice of you. -Yeah. Yeah, of course.
So you speak fluent Italian. How'd that happen?
Well, actually, I also speak French and German.
Little bit of Mandarin.
-You speak a little Mandarin? -A bit.
[in Mandarin] I kid you not!
[in English] No, it's… I'm a language major, so…
-Got it. Cool. You don't hear that-- -Grazie.
Thank you very much.
Um, so how do you while away the hours these days?
Actually, I just applied for a job as a translator at the UN.
-It's a long shot. -Long shot? Why is it a long shot?
Isn't everything?
-Um, sorry, I should take this. -Sure. No problem. -One second. -Sure.
translation.ko: - 미안해요, 전화 좀 받고 올게요 - 그럼요, 괜찮아요

translation.en: I'll see you at the table, all right? Welcome home, stranger!
Dion, hey! How are you?
-Man, how long has it been? -It's been a while. 12th grade.
translation.ko: - 얼마 만이지? - 한참 됐지, 12학년 때 봤으니

translation.en: Yeah, you disappeared. Where did you go to college, anyway?
You know, I didn't go. I ended up… I went to Paris. School of life.
translation.ko: 안 갔어, 파리에 갔지 인생 대학교

translation.en: Oh, that's right. You look exactly the same.
Only richer.
Is it true they're turning your new book into a movie?
I don't know. I mean, this is what they say.
-Hometown hero. -Thank you very much. You're very kind.
-It's great seeing you, man. -Good to see you.
Sorry about that.
-Where were we? -We were, um…
Potential job. UN. Long shot.
translation.ko: 일자리 지원, UN 가능성 작다는 얘기요

translation.en: Yeah, it's…
I don't know, with this new job, it could be challenging. I don't know.
-We may have to move and it's just… -"We"?
Yeah, Alan and me.
-And Alan is? -Oh, God, sorry. Alan's my fiancé.
translation.ko: - 앨런이 누군데요? - 어머, 미안해요, 내 약혼자요

translation.en: Oh, you're engaged?
Hey, congratulations. I love love.
-Great. Thank you. -Cheers. This is wonderful.
Um, we haven't set a date yet.
And Alan wants to, but if I do get this job, then…
translation.ko: 앨런은 잡고 싶어 하지만 혹시라도 이번 일 합격하면

translation.en: I don't-- We'll just have to figure it out, I guess. Haven't even looked for engagement rings yet.
translation.ko: 여러 가지로 문제니까요 약혼반지도 안 봤어요

translation.en: Well, we went last week, and I don't know, I couldn't pick anything.
translation.ko: 지난주에 보러 가긴 했지만 아무것도 못 골랐죠

translation.en: So I just… we just left and then…
Actually, this was kind of cute. On the walk home, he gave me this.
translation.ko: 사실 귀여운 얘기가 있어요 집에 오는 길에 이걸 주더라고요

translation.en: -[Jacob] What's that? -It's…
Cigar ring.
Believe it or not, this silly ring came as kind of a relief.
translation.ko: 이 바보 같은 반지가 위로가 됐어요

translation.en: -Yeah? -I'm not into all that "Diamonds Are a Girl's Best Friend" kind of stuff.
translation.ko: '다이아몬드는 여자의 절친' 이런 말, 안 믿거든요

translation.en: The truth is I'm kind of ambivalent about the concept of being engaged.
translation.ko: 사실 약혼이라는 개념에 대해 상반된 감정이 들어요

translation.en: -Mmm-hmm. -One the one hand, I like the certainty,
but on the other, it makes you feel kind of boxed in, you know?
Yeah, no, "boxed in" is something I've managed to avoid my entire life.
translation.ko: '꼼짝 못 하는' 건 나도 평생 피했던 거네요

translation.en: In my case, it's tricky 'cause Alan likes doing things by the book.
translation.ko: 앨런은 원칙대로 하는 걸 좋아해서 까다로워요

translation.en: And it's important to respect what the other person wants. Right?
translation.ko: 상대가 원하는 걸 존중하는 게 중요하잖아요

translation.en: -Mmm-hmm. -But he's a tax attorney!
He's very, very good at his job, and he's super precise.
Believe me, he'll be the one planning our wedding down to the very last place card.
translation.ko: 식장 좌석표까지 우리 결혼식도 앨런이 다 짜겠죠

translation.en: It's gonna run like clockwork.
And the good thing is, then I promise I'll shut up, but I think, I don't know, Alan and I complement one another.
translation.ko: 다행이니 난 입 다물고 있어야죠 그런 점에선 서로 보완이 돼요

translation.en: And that's how it's… It's supposed to be like that, right?
I mean, I'm not an expert on the subject, but, yeah, that sounds about right.
translation.ko: 제가 전문가는 아니지만 맞는 말 같네요

translation.en: Well, for better or worse, I am.
I don't know, I think being adopted, I'm just…
I'm always trying to fill some kind of void.
I'm always looking for security and reliability,
and that's why I think if I find my real-- my birth mom, it's…
I don't know, it'll resolve this huge uncertainty in my life and then…
-I don't know. -You'll be free.
-Yeah. -Come on.
[Rachel] Honestly, I really would have been happy to split it.
[Jacob] Oh, come on. No, it was my pleasure. Good food, good company.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 제가 사야죠 좋은 음식에 좋은 대화였는데

translation.en: That's a three-hour date.
I guess the universe really does reward the brave.
translation.ko: 우주는 용감한 사람에게 보상을 주나 봐요

translation.en: [sighs] I should probably tackle another room.
translation.ko: 전 이제 다른 방을 치워야 해요

translation.en: Hey, um, I was actually wondering, do you think there's a…
there's a chance your parents kept something of my mother's?
translation.ko: 우리 엄마 물건을 갖고 계시진 않을까요?

translation.en: A card? A photo?
Anything?
-[Rachel grunts] Yeah. Okay. -Be careful now.
-[Jacob] You got it? All right. -Yeah. Okay.
-[Jacob] Plop it right here's fine. -Oh, God.
-Is there a dead body in there? -I'm afraid to look to be honest with you.
-Hey, who played? -Huh?
Oh, my mom forced me to take lessons when I was a kid.
-At first, I pretty much hated it. -And then?
Then it made her really happy to hear me play, so…
Will you play something for me?
-Play something for you? Come on. No. -Seriously.
Seriously, I wanna see if the piano sounds as beautiful as it looks.
translation.ko: 저 피아노가 보기만큼 소리도 아름다운지 궁금해요

translation.en: Please?
All right. It's been a while, so I'm probably a little rusty.
translation.ko: 알았어요, 안 친 지 좀 됐으니 실력은 예전 같지 않을 거예요

translation.en: ♪ 'Cause your mama's all alone ♪
♪ I have tried in vain ♪
♪ Never more to call your name ♪
♪ When you left, you broke my heart ♪
translation.ko: 네가 떠났을 때 내 마음은 찢어졌어

translation.en: ♪ 'Cause I never thought we'd part ♪
♪ Every hour in the day You will hear me say ♪
translation.ko: 매일 매시간 내가 말하는 걸 듣게 될 거야

translation.en: ♪ Baby, won't you please come home? ♪
translation.ko: 아가, 이제 제발 집에 오지 않을래?

translation.en: ♪ Oh, home ♪
♪ Baby ♪
♪ Won't you please come home? ♪
Wow.
[Rachel] Ah! Young love.
-[Ellie] Hi! -So how was the date?
It went well.
Just well?
It went very well.
This is my friend, Rachel. -[Ellie] Hi! -Hi, nice to meet you.
Rachel's got a question I think maybe only you can answer.
translation.ko: 레이철의 의문에 답해 줄 유일한 분이세요

translation.en: [Ellie] Of course, I remember her.
She was a babysitter, a live-in babysitter,
like, you know, like an au pair.
[Rachel] Right. Right, sure.
She was very young. Seventeen, maybe 18 at the most.
She must have moved before the baby was born.
translation.ko: 아기가 태어나기 전 이 집에 왔죠

translation.en: Do you remember her name or…
Gosh, that's a good question.
Seems like it had something to do with Christmas,
like, um, Christina or Joy.
I'm drawing a blank, but you know who would know?
translation.ko: 난 기억력이 영 꽝이지만 아는 사람이 있으니 다행이네요

translation.en: -Who's that? -Your dad.
No, I don't, um… No.
Well, anyway, he lives in Vermont now.
It's way up in the mountains in a little town called Cornwall Bridge,
living pretty much off the grid.
How do you… [sighs] How do you know all that?
When I saw him at the funeral, we had a nice long chat.
translation.ko: 장례식에서 만났을 때 한참 얘기를 나눴거든

translation.en: You know, I really don't think there would be any harm in talking--
translation.ko: 얘기 좀 나눈다고 뭐 손해 볼 것도…

translation.en: "Harm in talking"? No, there will be harm. I haven't spoken to the guy in 35 years, Ellie, come on.
translation.ko: 손해요? 당연히 있죠 35년 동안 연락 안 한 사이예요

translation.en: [hesitates] No, I'm aware, but--
No, no, no. I'm… Excuse me.
Sorry. It's, uh…
-[door closes] -[Ellie] Oh, Jacob.
Now you know why he stayed away so long.
translation.ko: 왜 그렇게 오래 떠나 있었는지 알겠죠?

translation.en: It would be good for him if he could get over it.
-[Jacob] Rachel! Rachel, wait! -What?
-Listen. -Yeah?
I know all that stuff in there with my dad probably seemed irrational.
translation.ko: 아빠랑 관련해서 아까 일은 비이성적으로 보였을 거예요

translation.en: Oh, no, Jake, please. You don't owe me any explanation, okay?
I'm just some stranger who showed up on your doorstep. You don't owe me anything.
translation.ko: 당신 집 앞에 나타난 낯선 사람은 나예요, 나한테 빚진 거 없어요

translation.en: You've already helped me, like, a lot. So thank you. And…
I really hope you have a lovely… a lovely Christmas.
You headed home?
No, I'm going to Cornwall Bridge.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 콘월 브리지에 가 볼 거예요

translation.en: I need to know if I ever mattered to her. Maybe you've wondered that about your dad?
translation.ko: 엄마한테 내가 중요했는지 알고 싶어요 똑같은 감정, 아빠한테 느끼죠?

translation.en: Truth is, if I ever saw him, I wouldn't know what to say to him.
translation.ko: 만난다 해도 뭐라고 해야 할지 모르겠어요

translation.en: Well, maybe if you're up for a drive,
we could script a few lines.
[Jacob] Come on.
Hop on up.
You're leaving! I guess it's, uh, time to head home?
Well, yes and no, actually.
-How you doing? Jake Turner. Pleasure. -Oh, Ian Page. Pleased to meet you.
translation.ko: - 제이크 터너입니다, 반가워요 - 이언 페이지예요, 반가워요

translation.en: -I'm a big fan of your work, really. -Oh, thank you.
I told Ian that you basically wrote my profile.
translation.ko: 이언한테 내 프로필은 네가 써 준 거라고 했어

translation.en: Ah, well, you know, she made me take out all the racy stuff.
[laughs] Well, all's I can say is meeting Eleanor
translation.ko: 엘레노어는 최고의 크리스마스 선물이라고 할 수 있죠

translation.en: is the greatest Christmas surprise I could ask for.
translation.ko: 최고의 크리스마스 선물이라고 할 수 있죠

translation.en: Ian plays first violin with the Hartford Symphony.
translation.ko: 이언은 하트퍼드 교향악단에서 제1 바이올린을 맡고 있어

translation.en: Is that right? That's impressive. -That's great. -Thanks, mate.
What did you mean when you said you were leaving, "Yes and no"?
translation.ko: 떠난다는 게 맞기도 하고 아니기도 하다는 건 무슨 뜻이니?

translation.en: Yes, I'm leaving. No, I'm not going home. Uh, Rachel's supposed to be--
translation.ko: 떠나는 건 맞는데 집에 가진 않죠 레이철이 오면

translation.en: -Oh, there she is. Hey. -Hey.
She's convinced me-- And you, uh…
I'm gonna go see my dad.
Jacob.
Good for you.
Well, the universe rewards the brave, right?
You ready for this?
[sighs] Absolutely not. You?
No.
Let's go.
[Jacob] Don't you think Waze would be easier?
Yeah, of course it would. But maps are so much nicer, it's like a…
translation.ko: 당연히 그렇겠죠 하지만 지도가 훨씬 나아요 가상 세계를 촉각으로 느끼니까요

translation.en: tactile thing in a virtual world, you know?
translation.ko: 하지만 지도가 훨씬 나아요 가상 세계를 촉각으로 느끼니까요

translation.en: Yeah, I know. I had this idea… I had this idea for a book about that.
translation.ko: 알아요, 그런 내용에 관한 책의 아이디어도 떠올린 적 있죠

translation.en: -A Stephen King thriller-type thing. -Yeah?
Yeah, yeah, so here's what I came up with. There's this couple, right?
translation.ko: 네, 내가 생각해낸 건 이거예요 - 신혼여행 가는 커플이 있어요 - 네

translation.en: -They're on their honeymoon. -Okay.
And they're in a rental car.
The GPS is, like, possessed or something, or maybe the ex-boyfriend hacked into it.
translation.ko: 그런데 GPS가 뭐에 씌었던지 전 남자 친구가 해킹했던지 그래요

translation.en: That might be better, I'm not sure. Anyway.
translation.ko: 좋을 수도 있겠지만 어쨌든 GPS 때문에 둘은 심각한 위험에 처해요

translation.en: Whatever the case, the GPS leads them into mortal danger.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 GPS 때문에 둘은 심각한 위험에 처해요

translation.en: You hate it. Bad? It's bad.
No, no, no! You know, I like it. I like it.
But what happens next? I mean, like, after they're in mortal danger.
translation.ko: 하지만 다음은요? 심각한 위험에 처한 후 말이어요

translation.en: Yeah, I don't-- That's as far as I got. Never wrote it.
-[laughs] All right. -That's it. Well, as my dad said, "No creative idea's ever wasted."
translation.ko: 우리 아빠가 그러셨죠 '창의적 아이디어는 다 소중하다'

translation.en: -So there you go. -I like that.
[Rachel] Okay, in three miles, take I-91 North. -[Jacob] 91 North. You got it. -Yup.
translation.ko: - 5km 더 가서 I-91 북쪽을 타요 - 91번 북쪽, 알았어요

translation.en: [Rachel] Alan always gets kind of annoyed when I give him directions.
translation.ko: 앨런은 내가 길을 알려줄 때마다 짜증을 내요

translation.en: -Really? -He says he doesn't need a co-pilot.
I could use any navigational help I can get.
translation.ko: 난 사공이 제발 좀 있었으면 하는데요

translation.en: Speaking of Alan,
what's he think about this, um, this job you applied for in New York?
translation.ko: 지원한 뉴욕 일자리에 관해선 어떻게 생각한대요?

translation.en: Um, actually, I, uh…
He doesn't… I haven't told him about it yet.
What's he think about this trip to Cornwall Bridge? Uh, he's not thrilled. He's not thrilled.
translation.ko: - 이번 콘월 브리지 여행은요? - 좋아하지 않더군요

translation.en: And actually he was kind of… peeved.
Yeah. No, let me guess, it's, uh…
He's upset that you are taking a road trip with this guy you just met?
translation.ko: 잘 알지도 모르는 남자와 여행 간다고 화난 거군요

translation.en: No, actually. No, it was, um…
It was about the… the gas money.
No, it's just like one of those little Alan quirks. [Jacob] Okay.
translation.ko: - 앨런의 특이한 점 중 하나죠 - 알았어요

translation.en: It's no big deal, and in the grand scheme of things, it's meaningless, right?
translation.ko: 사실 별거 아니고 큰 그림에서 보면 사소한 거잖아요

translation.en: I'm kind of insulted. He's not concerned about me, right?
translation.ko: 이거 모욕당한 기분인데요? 날 전혀 신경 안 쓴다고요?

translation.en: -He's concerned about gas money. -Well, he doesn't know about you.
translation.ko: - 기름값만 신경 쓰고 - 제이컵과 가는 건 몰라요

translation.en: [Rachel] As it turns out, I didn't really know about you either.
translation.ko: 말이 나와서 말인데 저도 제이컵을 몰랐더군요

translation.en: -What are you talking about? -I finally broke down and I Googled you.
-Oh, come on. -And, honestly, I tried to put it off.
translation.ko: 아, 진짜 안 하려고 했었어요 뒷조사 같은 거 싫어하거든요

translation.en: Because I really don't like looking people up.
translation.ko: 안 하려고 했었어요 뒷조사 같은 거 싫어하거든요

translation.en: It always seems like an intrusion, somehow.
-Uh-huh. -But now… I'm really glad I did.
-No. -'Cause now I know you're this, like, super-famous, best-selling novelist, so…
translation.ko: 엄청나게 유명한 베스트셀러 작가라는 걸 이제 알거든요

translation.en: Uh, super famous is a bit of a stretch, I think.
Well, um, five million copies sold--
It's like five and a half at this point, but it's okay, who's counting?
translation.ko: 지금은 550만 부예요 하지만 누가 세는 거죠?

translation.en: And number one on The New York Times Best Seller List.
-I got lucky. -And, uh, translated into 30 languages.
-I think that makes you super famous. -Oh.
Here was little old me worried about how you were gonna pay for dinner.
translation.ko: 그런데 나는 제이컵이 낼 저녁값 걱정이나 했네요

translation.en: Hey, do you mind grabbing my wallet? It's in the backpack in the back there.
translation.ko: 내 지갑 좀 꺼내 줄래요? 뒷좌석에 둔 가방에 있어요

translation.en: -Thank you very much. -Mmm-hmm.
-[grunts] -Jake, do you know what this is?
No. You know what? I just, uh… That was in a box marked "personal" at my mom's.
I just kinda picked it up, and I didn't look at it. What is it?
translation.ko: 그냥 주워 놓은 뒤 안 봤죠 뭔데요?

translation.en: [voice breaking] Okay, listen to this.
"My name is Noel Ellis."
"I'm 17 years old, and I'm having a baby."
This is my mother's diary.
I know it. I know it.
Her name is Noel. I can't believe this.
[laughing incredulously] I can't-- I just-- I can't--
"My parents sent me away to have my baby."
"They're ashamed of me."
[Noel] And they're ashamed of the child I'm bringing into this world.
translation.ko: 내가 이 세상에 데려올 아이도 부끄러워하신다

translation.en: And so, I'm leaving.
"They truly believe it's wrong for a woman to have a child outside of marriage."
translation.ko: '부모님은 미혼 여성이 애를 낳는 건 잘못이라고 믿는다'

translation.en: "'God disapproves,' they say."
[Noel] But doesn't God forgive our mistakes?
translation.ko: 하지만 하나님은 우리 잘못을 용서하는 분 아닌가?

translation.en: Everyone I know and trust has abandoned me.
translation.ko: 내가 알고 신뢰하던 모든 사람이 날 버렸다

translation.en: "Thankfully, this really kind family hired me as their nanny."
translation.ko: '다행히 이 착한 가족이 날 보모로 고용했다'

translation.en: [Noel] The Turners are a family of four.
[Rachel] "Scott and Lois and their little boys, Benjamin and Jacob."
translation.ko: '스콧과 로이스 이들의 두 아이, 벤저민과 제이컵'

translation.en: [Noel] Benji's seven and has loads of energy.
Jake is four, and he's the quiet one.
Do you have any memory of that? I know you were little, but…
I really don't.
[Noel] He likes me to read the Magic Tree House books to him.
translation.ko: 내가 '매직 트리 하우스' 책을 읽어 주면 좋아한다

translation.en: So where's Ben now?
Oh, there was this, um, snowstorm. It was around Christmas.
We had… We had this giant elm tree in our front yard.
translation.ko: 우리 집 앞마당에 큰 느릅나무가 있었어요

translation.en: Benji loved to climb and he was in that tree all the time.
translation.ko: 벤지는 나무 타는 걸 좋아했죠 늘 그 나무에 올라갔어요

translation.en: And that night, Ben decided he was gonna climb as high as he could in that tree.
translation.ko: 그리고 그날 밤 벤은 최대한 높이 올라가겠다며 나무를 탔는데

translation.en: And hang his favorite ornament…
[Rachel] ♪ Don't know why ♪
♪ There's no sun up in the sky Stormy weather… ♪
Sorry about earlier, I got so emotional talking about my brother.
No, it's… You don't need to apologize. I understand.
Thanks.
It's been over 30 years, you know? You'd think I'd be able to… talk about it.
translation.ko: 30년이 넘었으니 얘기할 수 있을 거라고 생각하겠죠

translation.en: You know that saying, "Time heals all wounds"?
It doesn't.
[Noel] It's been two months now,
and I still haven't heard a word from either of my parents or Peter.
translation.ko: 부모님도 피터도 여전히 아무 연락이 없다

translation.en: [Rachel] "One day in my room, I just couldn't stop crying…"
translation.ko: '어느 날 방에서 울음을 그치지 못하고 있는데'

translation.en: [both] And there was this quiet knock on the door.
[Rachel] "And little Jacob came in."
[Noel] He laid his head on my shoulder, and it was as if he understood.
translation.ko: 나를 이해한다는 듯이 내 어깨에 머리를 기대었다

translation.en: I love that kid more and more every day.
translation.ko: 난 그 애를 점점 더 사랑하고 있다

translation.en: I know you're not supposed to have favorites, but…
translation.ko: 편애하면 안 된다는 건 알지만 어쩔 수 없다

translation.en: [waitress] One New York, rare,
and one vegetarian plate, no peppers, no carrots, no onions, sauce on the side.
translation.ko: 그리고 채식 플레이트 하나 피망, 당근, 양파는 빼고 소스 뿌리지 말고 따로요

translation.en: Thank you. Perfect.
-Hey, can I ask you a question? -Can I stop you?
translation.ko: - 질문 하나 해도 돼요? - 질문 막아도 돼요?

translation.en: -No. -[chuckles]
Why is it that a handsome, successful guy like you is still single?
translation.ko: 당신처럼 잘생기고 성공한 남자가 왜 아직 싱글이죠?

translation.en: -Handsome? -Don't deflect.
-I like to be alone, I guess, you know? -Hmm. Safer that way. I get it.
translation.ko: 혼자 있는 걸 좋아하는 거 같아요 그게 더 편하죠, 나도 알아요

translation.en: But you're engaged.
Still, there's always that, like, push-pull thing, you know?
translation.ko: 그래도 늘 마음이 왔다 갔다 해요

translation.en: -Mmm. -"Come closer."
-"I want to be alone." You know? -[chuckles] Mmm-hmm.
I mean, I've had relationships in the past, don't get me wrong.
translation.ko: 나도 과거엔 연애 했었어요 오해하지 마세요

translation.en: I've had serious relationships in the past, a few of them anyway, but…
translation.ko: 몇 번 진지하게 만난 적도 있죠

translation.en: You know, in the end, they all just, uh…
In the end, I just wasn't what they were looking for, you know?
translation.ko: 네, 내가 그 여자들 눈에 안 차더라고요

translation.en: Maybe they weren't what you were looking for.
translation.ko: 그 여자들이 제이컵 눈에 안 찼나 보죠

translation.en: Uh, question. What are the odds of us making it through the pass before the storm hits?
translation.ko: 오늘 폭풍우가 오기 전 산길을 통과할 확률은 얼마나 될까요?

translation.en: -Tonight? -Yeah.
Ooh, I'd say about…
zero.
-[Jacob] Percent? -Percent.
Why don't you check us in? I think Ava needs to stretch her legs.
translation.ko: 체크인하고 있을래요? 에이바 산책 좀 시켜 줄게요

translation.en: -Sure! Meet you back here in 20? -Yeah.
All right.
[Rachel] Hey! [Alan] Hey, stranger.
Look, I, uh, I wanted to apologize for the other night.
I know this stuff with your mom, trying to find her--
translation.ko: 엄마를 찾으려고 자기가 애쓰는 거 말이야

translation.en: No, no, no, Alan. Don't worry. Don't worry. It's fine.
Uh, so, listen, on a forward-thinking note,
I had an idea for our engagement party.
[chuckles] Yeah?
Yeah, you know that Mexican restaurant you love, Casa Frida?
translation.ko: 자기가 좋아하는 멕시코 식당 '카사 프리다' 알지?

translation.en: -Uh-huh. -So it's available Valentine's Day,
which is perfect for an engagement party, right?
Plus, they are giving us a phenomenal price.
translation.ko: 게다가 엄청나게 저렴한 가격에 대관할 수 있어

translation.en: Oh, that sounds great.
Yeah? So my plan is give them a deposit first thing tomorrow morning.
translation.ko: 그래? 내일 아침에 계약금을 걸자는 게 내 계획이야

translation.en: Alan, can we just…
Can we just wait on Casa Frida?
Till I get back.
Of course, babe. Yeah. Whatever you want.
translation.ko: 물론 그래도 돼, 자기 원하는 대로

translation.en: -When are you back? -Soon.
Okay. Love you.
I love you too.
You're in luck! Got two rooms left. Great! Terrific.
translation.ko: - 운이 좋네요, 방 두 개 남았어요 - 잘됐네요, 끝내줘요

translation.en: You know, if this were a rom-com, you'd have one room left.
translation.ko: 이게 로코였다면 방이 딱 하나 남아서

translation.en: We'd have to share it.
Rom-com?
Romantic comedy, rom-com.
-Oh, right! -Yeah.
Well, if it helps,
the rooms are connected.
Okay, I'm sorry, you're closing.
I was gonna head to the pageant, but it can wait. How can I help?
translation.ko: 축제 가려던 참이지만 괜찮아요 어떤 걸 찾으시나요?

translation.en: I was wondering if you had any books by Jacob Turner?
[chuckles] Of course! How far along are you in the series?
Uh… I'm at the beginning, so I don't know.
Okay! You want Book One, Green Eyes of Paris. We should have that.
Great! So what's it about?
Paris in the '40s.
The French Resistance, espionage, forbidden love.
Oh, wow. Sounds pretty--
Riveting, right? And trust me, it is.
translation.ko: 확 끌리죠? 농담이 아니라 진짜 그래요

translation.en: The world this guy creates,
it's like you're actually there with his characters.
It's what makes the book so absorbing.
That's probably why I have such a hard time keeping them on the shelves.
Ah! Look at that, you're in luck.
Thanks.
Not bad.
Yeah, and he writes almost as good as he looks.
translation.ko: 네, 게다가 외모 못지않게 글도 잘 쓴답니다

translation.en: -[Jacob] Hey. -Hey.
So, what do you think? Should we call it a night, or…
translation.ko: 어떻게 할래요? 그만 들어가 잘래요, 아니면

translation.en: "Or." Definitely "or."
Yeah! Yeah, yeah, come on.
Merry Christmas!
-There you are. -[customer] Thank you.
-[Jacob] Look at this. -Look at this! Hi! So cute.
translation.ko: - 이것 좀 봐요 - 안녕? 진짜 귀엽네요

translation.en: [Jacob] You better knock it off. She'll get jealous.
-[Jacob] Incredible. -[Rachel] I love it here.
-How are you? -Hi!
-Do you mind if we have… -[vendor] Absolutely.
-Thank you! You're giving these away? -[vendor] On the house.
-Thank you! -It's my favorite town.
-[Jacob] Smells great. -Happy holidays.
Oh, wow, look at that! I haven't seen this film in years.
translation.ko: 저것 좀 봐요 저 영화 본 지 진짜 오래됐는데

translation.en: -[Rachel] I've never seen it. -You're kidding. You're in for a treat.
translation.ko: - 난 본 적 없어요 - 농담이죠? 기대해도 좋아요

translation.en: Excuse me, are you two together?
Oh, no.
Yeah? Well, yeah. We were, you know--
Maybe we are.
-Smooth. -[Rachel laughing]
You okay?
I'm shakin' the dust of this crummy little town off my feet
and I'm gonna see the world! -Italy, Greece… -[inaudible]
[Rachel] Wow! That may be the best movie I've ever seen.
translation.ko: 내가 본 영화 중 최고로 기억될 거 같아요

translation.en: [Jacob] He wondered if this journey was about to take an unexpected turn.
translation.ko: '그는 이 여정이 예상치 못한 방향으로 흘러갈지 궁금해졌다'

translation.en: [Rachel gasps] Oh, my God. No way.
Everything okay in there?
-Hi. -Hi.
Yeah, I'm fine.
Great.
-I just-- I heard-- I thought I heard a-- -Oh, yeah, no.
[laughs] Thanks for checking, though. Appreciate it.
[nervously] Okay. Just, uh-- Well, just have a--
-[Rachel] Good night. -Good night.
[Jacob] How'd you sleep?
[laughs] Actually, I was up last night reading.
-Anything interesting? -Uh, yeah, very.
-Yeah? -Green Eyes of Paris.
-You know that one? [laughing] -I've heard of it. You…
[laughs] You bought my book and you didn't tell me? Yeah, well, I didn't…
translation.ko: - 내 책을 샀는데 말 안 했어요? - 그게

translation.en: -I didn't wanna tell you just in case-- -Just in case what?
translation.ko: - 혹시 몰라서 말 안 했어요 - 혹시, 뭔데요?

translation.en: In case I didn't like it.
-In case you didn't like it? -Yeah.
And?
Well…
No, it's okay. You can tell me. It's fine. My ego is, uh…
I think I can handle it.
-What's up? What did you think? -Okay, well, um…
-You know, I find it interesting… -Yeah.
…that you write these novels filled with suspense, and drama, romance,
and yet your main character, Henri,
he never lets anyone get close to him.
translation.ko: 누구도 가까이 오지 못하게 한단 거예요

translation.en: It's kinda like what we were talking about last night.
Henri lives in occupied France, right? He can't trust anybody.
translation.ko: 앙리는 독일에 점령된 프랑스에서 살고 있으니 아무도 못 믿죠

translation.en: Well, yeah, but…
This isn't occupied America. So what's your excuse?
translation.ko: 미국은 점령된 나라가 아니잖아요 제이컵은 왜 그래요?

translation.en: On the other hand…
-I really loved the book. -Yeah?
I loved it! It was just…
God, the ending?
It kind of blew me away.
Good. Good, good, good.
The endings are, uh… ending, it's… They're always hard to get right, you know. Yeah.
translation.ko: 결말은 항상 제대로 만들기 어렵거든요, 네

translation.en: Any thoughts on the current story? You gonna get that ending right?
translation.ko: 본인의 현재 이야기는요? 결말이 잘 나올 거 같아요?

translation.en: [Noel] I found out today I'm having a girl,
translation.ko: 뱃속 아기가 딸이라는 걸 오늘 알았다

translation.en: a sweet, little baby girl.
Before I left home, my parents told me not to name my baby.
translation.ko: 집을 떠나기 전에 부모님은 내게 아이 이름을 짓지 말라고 하셨다

translation.en: "Because it would only make it harder to say goodbye."
"But I've already… given her a name."
[Noel] My angel.
Um, can you pull over? I… I need… I need some air.
-You sure? It's freezing outside. -Yeah, please.
[Jacob] Okay. Sure.
Hey. Come on.
Ah! It's freezing out here. Here you go.
You all right?
[voice breaking] Why would she leave it behind?
Why go through the trouble of writing everything down
and documenting all these details if she wasn't…
translation.ko: 왜 수고스럽게 시시콜콜한 걸 다 쓰고

translation.en: if she was just gonna abandon it?
I don't know. You know, maybe she thought it would find its way back to you, eventually?
translation.ko: 글쎄요, 언젠가 이 일기가 레이철한테 들어갈 줄 알았나 보죠

translation.en: Or maybe she just wanted to forget everything.
Like it never existed.
-Like I never existed. -[quietly] No.
I'm supposed to be engaged. I'm supposed to be getting married.
-[Jacob] Oh, no! What are you-- No, wait! -[barking continues]
translation.ko: 이런, 안 돼 뭐 하는 거야? 기다려

translation.en: -Come on! where are you-- No! -Ava? Ava!
-[barking continues] -[Jacob] Ava!
Ava, no!
[whistling loudly] Ava Turner, get back here right now!
-What were you gonna do if you caught it? -Yeah.
[laughs] That was incredible.
Guess life's all about the chase, huh, Turner?
-[Jacob] I think we took a wrong turn. -[Rachel laughs]
-You mean you hope we took a wrong turn? -Exactly.
translation.ko: - 길을 잘못 들고 싶다는 거죠? - 맞아요

translation.en: Please tell me the universe really does reward the brave.
translation.ko: 우주는 용감한 자에게 보상을 준다고 말해 줘요

translation.en: You got this.
[sighs] Here we go.
[Jacob] It was a day he had both been anticipating…
and dreading.
Jacob.
You know, Eleanor called to say you might be coming.
I told her I didn't believe it,
but she said over and over again, "Just be prepared."
Are you?
Yeah! I… I'm cutting down this Christmas tree for you.
translation.ko: 그래, 널 위해 이 크리스마스트리도 베는 거야

translation.en: I've only been waiting for this moment for 30-odd years, and now that it's here…
Yeah. Same.
Mind giving me a hand?
Plus, if it's just you, what's the point, right?
translation.ko: 어차피 난 혼자 사는데 트리가 무슨 소용이겠니?

translation.en: [Jacob] Yeah, well, if it's any consolation, I've never had a tree,
translation.ko: 네, 위로될진 모르겠지만 저도 평생 트리 꾸민 적 없네요

translation.en: so you're ahead of me.
[Scott] All right. Welcome to my humble abode.
Here we go.
-Now just set this end down here. -Yeah.
[Scott] Can you tip it up?
-Gotta get the stand. -[Jacob] All right.
-You live out here all alone? -I do!
-All right. -[Jacob] Ellie painted that, right?
Good eye. Yeah, that's hers.
All right.
-I think that should do it. -[Jacob] Yeah?
-Look at that. -[Scott] Good job.
-[phone ringing] -[Scott] Oh. Excuse me.
[in background] Scott Turner. Hello?
Yes.
[Scott] See you then.
[grunts] Sorry about that.
That was, uh, one of my clients.
-Your clients? What do you do? -I'm a social worker at the VA.
translation.ko: - 고객요? 무슨 일 하세요? - 제대군인부 소속 사회복지사야

translation.en: Social, you're trying to do some good in the world?
Underline "trying."
You know, I bought these forever ago when I first moved in,
translation.ko: 정말 오래전 여기 이사 왔을 때 이걸 사놓고서는

translation.en: and I never even took them out of the box.
Think they still work?
I don't know.
Jake…
I know an apology doesn't mean a whole lot after all these years… You know what? It's…
You can save it.
I didn't come out here for a, uh, you know, reconciliation.
I'm only here to help a friend, honestly.
-A friend? -Yeah, a friend. It's a long story.
Well, since you're here, can I at least say what I've been waiting--
translation.ko: 네가 여기 왔으니 적어도 기다렸다는 말이라도…

translation.en: I'd, I'd… I'd really rather you didn't.
translation.ko: 그냥 아무 말도 안 하시는 게 낫겠어요

translation.en: I am sorry.
[mutters] You're sorry.
I am deeply, deeply sorry.
Yeah. Good. Good. So we're all set then.
translation.ko: 네, 좋아요 그러면 이제 준비는 다 됐네요

translation.en: You know, um, you left me alone with Mom,
translation.ko: 엄마 곁에 저를 내버려 두신 채

translation.en: and then you run up here, and you just disappear altogether…
translation.ko: 여기까지 와서 그간 완전히 사라지신 뒤

translation.en: [shouts] And you're sorry?
God! I said I wasn't gonna do this.
translation.ko: 미친다, 이래서 안 온다고 한 건데

translation.en: Uh, you know what? This was a mistake. I can't do this.
translation.ko: 그거 알아요? 이건 실수였어요 못 하겠네요

translation.en: -Jake! -Enjoy your tree.
-Hey! -No, I can't handle this.
translation.ko: 더는 못 해요 좋은 생각이 아니었어요

translation.en: -I thought this was a good idea. Let's go. -What?
translation.ko: 더는 못 해요 좋은 생각이 아니었어요 - 가요 - 잠깐, 숨 좀 쉬어요, 네?

translation.en: Wait, just take a breath, okay? Take a breath.
translation.ko: - 가요 - 잠깐, 숨 좀 쉬어요, 네?

translation.en: You know, if you walk away now, that's it, right?
It's over. Forever.
-Well, it's been over for 35 years-- -Stop! Jake.
If you leave now,
you are doing exactly what he did.
Right?
Why don't you just try being the first adult in your family not to take the exit?
translation.ko: 가족 중 처음으로 비상구로 나가지 않는 어른이 되세요

translation.en: Please.
[Scott] Jake, it's just so hard to talk about…
but two days before Christmas,
we had the biggest snowstorm of the winter.
And Benji, like every year,
couldn't wait to hang his favorite ornament
high up in the branches of our old elm tree.
translation.ko: 집 앞 오래된 느릅나무 가지에 걸려고 했지

translation.en: He'd climbed up so many times to that platform that I'd built for you guys.
translation.ko: 내가 너희를 위해 만든 나무 위 단에 몇 번이나 올라갔어

translation.en: [Scott] I knew the branches could be slippery…
translation.ko: 난 나뭇가지가 미끄러울 거라고 생각은 했지만

translation.en: but he was such a determined little guy.
translation.ko: 벤지의 결심이 확고해 말릴 수 없었지

translation.en: I thought, "I'll just let him hang the ornament."
[Scott] The sound of that branch cracking will never leave me.
translation.ko: 그날 나뭇가지가 부러지던 소리는 절대 잊을 수 없다

translation.en: I was Benji's father.
I should have stopped him.
The following April,
I cut down that tree.
It didn't help at all.
And after Noel left,
your mom and I just…
couldn't comfort each other anymore.
And it got to the point where one of us had to leave.
translation.ko: 둘 중 하나가 떠나야 할 지경까지 이르렀지

translation.en: I wanted to take you with me,
but I just couldn't do that to her.
You were all she had left.
[sighs] I told myself that with you there,
somehow she'd find her way back.
You know, you used to love stringing the lights when you were little.
translation.ko: 넌 어릴 적 전구를 줄에 매다는 걸 좋아했었지

translation.en: You remember?
[Rachel] So, tell me, be honest,
do you think we should go in or just let them be?
translation.ko: 들어가 봐야 할까? 아니면 둘만 있게 둘까?

translation.en: Okay, I guess we'll let them be. Okay. I heard you.
You know, I tried to stay in touch.
At first, I called. Left messages for you. For years, I wrote letters to you.
translation.ko: 처음엔 전화해서 메시지를 남겼지 몇 년간 편지도 보냈고

translation.en: I've never seen a letter or a message. Mom never told me.
translation.ko: 편지나 메시지 받은 적 없어요 엄마는 아무 말 안 하셨어요

translation.en: -So are you married? -[laughs] Married? No, I'm not. No.
I read your first couple of books.
translation.ko: 네가 초반에 낸 책 몇 권은 읽었어

translation.en: But my eyesight's not what it was, so I listened to the third one on audio.
translation.ko: 시력이 예전 같지 않아서 3권은 오디오북으로 들었지

translation.en: I mean, it's the first time I got to hear your adult voice.
translation.ko: 그때 처음으로 성인이 된 네 목소리를 들었다

translation.en: It was fantastic.
I love 'em.
[Jacob] Oh, I remember.
I think Benji called you a butterfingers…
translation.ko: 벤지가 너 물건 잘 떨어뜨린다고 놀리던 기억이 나

translation.en: That's beautiful.
Here's hoping.
-There you go. -[Scott chuckles]
-Success! -[whines]
Didn't you say you came here to help a friend?
[Scott] Hey. How's the weather?
It's chili!
Here it comes.
-Excuse me, girl. This is not for you. -[Rachel laughs]
Noel was a godsend.
After we lost Jacob's brother,
she was the glue that kept us from completely coming apart.
translation.ko: 노엘 덕분에 우리가 완전히 망가지지 않을 수 있었죠

translation.en: -Here you go. -Oh, thank you.
Now, bear with me. I've been making this chili for myself for 35 years,
translation.ko: 이 말은 해야겠군요, 내가 칠리를 만든 지는 35년이 됐지만

translation.en: so I have no idea if it's safe for public consumption.
translation.ko: 솔직히 다른 사람한테 먹여도 되는진 모르겠어요

translation.en: -Smells good. I'll tell you that. -All right, son, here you go.
translation.ko: - 냄새 좋네요, 그건 확실해요 - 자, 너도

translation.en: Oh, it's more than safe. It's really good. Thank you.
-[Jacob] Mmm. That's great. -[Rachel] It's really great.
Fantastic.
So would you happen to know
where Noel moved or where she might live now?
translation.ko: 현재 살 만한 곳을 혹시 아실까요?

translation.en: You know, she sent me something years ago. Hold on.
translation.ko: 몇 년 전에 나한테 뭔가를 보낸 적이 있죠, 잠깐만요

translation.en: -[Rachel] Really? -[Scott] Excuse me, baby.
[whispering] What do you think?
Um, you have his eyes.
Really?
Yeah.
It's a good thing.
Well…
-[Scott] I, uh… Sorry. -[Ava whines]
I always held on to this. Don't ask me why.
translation.ko: 이걸 계속 갖고 있었어요 이유는 묻지 말아요

translation.en: It says she's gonna be living with her husband, Charles Hayden, in Ridgefield.
translation.ko: 남편 찰스 헤이든과 리지필드에서 살고 있다고 적혀 있네요

translation.en: Noel Hayden.
I gotta say it. You two would make a fantastic couple.
translation.ko: 이 말은 해야겠군요 두 사람은 멋진 커플이 될 거예요

translation.en: -No, no, Rachel's engaged. -Yeah.
-Really? -Yeah, big time.
-Congratulations. -Thank you.
He must be a great guy because you are one heck of a catch.
translation.ko: 약혼자는 대단한 사람이겠군요 아가씨는 탐나는 사람이니까요

translation.en: -That she is. -Okay. [laughs]
So, you'll let me know how everything turns out?
translation.ko: 상황 종료되고 나면 소식 전해줄 거죠?

translation.en: Oh, of course. Of course. Thank you. Thank you so much.
You're welcome, sweetheart.
Wish me luck.
-Best of luck. -Thanks.
I, uh…
-Thanks for wearing that watch, son. -Oh.
I can't tell you how much that means to me.
translation.ko: 제게 얼마나 의미가 큰지 모르실 거예요

translation.en: Yeah, come on. Come on.
You grew up good. Real good.
Well, um, stay in touch.
-A hundred percent. -Okay.
[Rachel] You okay?
Yeah. Yeah, I'm okay. Thank you.
Yeah.
[Noel] Today, my sweet baby girl was born.
And I know I will never see her again.
translation.ko: 다신 못 볼 거란 건 안다

translation.en: "So I'm gonna leave this diary behind."
"Maybe someday she'll read it and understand how much I love her."
[Noel crying] And always will.
"And always will."
God, I hope that's true… [sniffles]
…what she said about loving me.
[Rachel] So I was thinking about Noel.
Should I call her first, or do you think I should just show up tomorrow?
translation.ko: 먼저 전화부터 할까요? 아니면 내일 그냥 찾아갈까요?

translation.en: -What do you… what do you think? -Hmm.
I think get some sleep and decide in the morning.
Yeah.
[chuckles] Like I'm gonna sleep.
[clerk] Um, let me just triple check to make sure.
Oh, gosh, I'm sorry, but we only have one room available.
-Oh, no, uh… -We'll take it.
We'll take it?
Yeah, we'll…
-You know, we'll take it. -[clerk laughs] Great.
Thank you.
[Rachel] So…
I have a confession to make.
-Confession? -Yep.
Uh-oh! What'd she do?
Today is my birthday.
-No! -Yeah.
-Today's your birthday? -Yeah.
You're kidding. You're just now telling me this? This is…
-What? You should have said something. -Yeah.
This is a big deal. You should've said something.
You know, you, uh, we can-- You know, it's a birthday. These are--
-[chuckling] What are you doing? -We're gonna celebrate your birthday!
Hi! This is Jake Turner from the Amber Suite.
I was wondering if--
Yeah, that Jake Turner. I-- Thank you. I appreciate it.
translation.ko: 네, 그 제이크 터너입니다 감사합니다, 네

translation.en: Listen, I was wondering if you could do me a favor?
[voice fading] I've got a birthday girl up here. I just found out.
translation.ko: 생일을 맞은 아가씨가 있는데 방금 알았어요

translation.en: I know it's late notice, but do you have a birthday cake
translation.ko: 갑작스럽게 말씀드려 죄송하지만 혹시 생일 케이크라든가

translation.en: or something, a dessert you can put candles in?
translation.ko: 초를 꽂을 수 있는 디저트 같은 게 있을까요?

translation.en: [Jacob] You do? Terrific.
Uh, you know what? Yes, more red wine.
And you might as well send up some champagne too
because it's a birthday, champagne is for celebrating.
Wonderful. Thank you very much.
-You wanna dance? -Really?
Yeah.
-Really? -Yeah, come on. It's my birthday.
It's your birthday. You're right. Okay.
translation.ko: 레이철의 생일이니 무슨 말이든 따라야죠, 네

translation.en: Happy birthday, Rachel.
Make a wish.
Way ahead of you.
[Rachel] Dear Jake.
First of all, I want you to know that last night was beautiful.
And I'd be lying if I didn't admit
that I've been thinking about it since the moment we met.
translation.ko: 처음 만났을 때부터 이 순간을 꿈꿨던 거 같아요

translation.en: But I woke up in the middle of the night feeling confused.
Really, really confused.
And the thing is Alan really loves me,
translation.ko: 문제는 앨런이 날 진심으로 사랑한다는 거예요

translation.en: and that's not nothing.
And you have a very different life
with best-selling books, and a million Instagram followers,
translation.ko: 인스타 팔로워가 100만 명에 달하는 베스트셀러 작가니

translation.en: and I'm… just getting launched,
which I totally understand, at least to the extent that I can.
translation.ko: 충분히 이해해요 적어도 할 수 있는 한에서는요

translation.en: It's just that I'm a person who needs a lot of certainty in their life.
translation.ko: 단지 난 삶에서 확신이 필요한 사람이에요

translation.en: And this time with you, wonderful though it was,
translation.ko: 그래서 제이컵과 함께한 시간이 정말 좋았지만

translation.en: it isn't that.
So I think it's better that we part company now
translation.ko: 그러니 이제 우린 너무 늦기 전에

translation.en: before it's too late,
at least for me.
And I realized something else,
My whole life, I thought my mother didn't want me
translation.ko: 난 평생 엄마가 날 원하지 않는다고 생각했어요

translation.en: and that I needed to find her and ask her why.
translation.ko: 그래서 엄마를 찾아가 이유를 묻고 싶었죠

translation.en: But now that I've read her diary, I know that she did truly love me,
translation.ko: 하지만 일기를 읽고 나니 날 정말 사랑했단 걸 알겠어요

translation.en: and that's all that really matters.
Thank you for everything,
for going on this wild, life-changing ride with me.
translation.ko: 함께해줘서 고마워요 베풀어 준 모든 것에 고마워요

translation.en: I'll never, ever forget it.
And, lastly,
I'll never, ever forget you.
-Pardon me, the, uh, nurses' station? -Um, down the hall, to the right.
translation.ko: - 실례합니다, 간호사실이 어디죠? - 복도 끝에서 우회전요

translation.en: -To the right. Thank you. -Welcome.
Excuse me. Hi, can you tell me where to find Noel Hayden?
translation.ko: 실례합니다, 노엘 헤이든 씨를 어디 가면 만날 수 있죠?

translation.en: Hi, I'm Noel.
I called your house, your husband told me where to find you.
I don't know if you remember me or not, but, um…
I'm Jacob Turner.
Jacob?
Wow.
How are your folks?
Uh, my folks? My, um…
My mom just recently passed away.
-I'm so sorry. -Thank you. Yeah, it was very sudden.
-But your dad, he's-- -He's good. He's, um…
Yeah, I just saw him for the first time in a really long time, actually.
He's… He's good. He's hanging in.
Like the rest of us.
Like the rest of us, yeah.
You gotta be wondering why I'm here after all these years.
translation.ko: 오랜 세월이 지나 왜 지금 찾아왔나 궁금하시겠죠

translation.en: It's a really long, complicated story, but…
Noel, when my brother died,
I didn't realize until just recently how much you helped my family, how much you helped me.
translation.ko: 몰랐어요, 최근에야 노엘이 저랑 가족을 돌봐준 걸 알았죠

translation.en: -You were just a little kid, Jake. -But if you hadn't been there--
But I was.
And you got through it.
Now that I'm here, I can say thank you.
translation.ko: 여기 왔으니 말인데 드디어 고맙단 말을 할게요

translation.en: Now that you're here,
you're welcome.
There's one other thing I wanted to talk to you about before I left, um…
translation.ko: 가기 전에 하고 싶은 얘기가 하나 더 있어요

translation.en: The child that you had, your daughter.
Rachel.
She's…
wonderful, she's amazing.
I wanted you to know that.
You know her?
I do know her, um…
Yeah, she wanted to come here, she wanted to meet you in person.
translation.ko: 여기 와서 직접 만나고 싶어 했답니다

translation.en: And I think, you know, after… after reading this…
she felt a connection for sure, and, uh…
she understands everything. Everything.
[voice breaks] Thank you for telling me that.
Merry Christmas.
Merry Christmas, Jacob.
And thank you for this.
It's a precious gift.
And, Jake…
if you see my daughter,
would you tell her that if she ever wants to get in touch,
translation.ko: 혹시 연락하고 싶을 경우 언제든지 하라고

translation.en: I would like that very much.
Rachel.
[woman] Your dad's been working on this since Thanksgiving.
I can't wait to see it.
I think it's the most beautiful he's ever done.
-[Rachel exclaims] Yeah? -[phone vibrating]
Uh, when will Alan be coming?
Uh, soon. Soon.
-You don't sound too excited, honey. -Well, I am, I just…
translation.ko: - 별로 신나 하지 않는구나 - 신나요, 단지

translation.en: I don't know, "excited" is a bit… a strong word.
[man] I couldn't get it right until finally last night at, like, 2:00 a.m.
translation.ko: 오늘 새벽 2시에야 겨우 제대로 만들 수 있었어

translation.en: No, you got it right, Dad. This is… It's perfect.
I love it. This is… It's perfect. Thank you.
Honey, you don't want to talk to Alan?
No, no, it's not that. It's just that I don't, um…
I don't know. Things are… We'll talk later, and it's…
We're sorting things… sorting some things out right now.
"Sorting some things out"? I thought you guys made up.
No, we-- We did, we just--
You know, things are a little up in the air right now.
This is starting to sound a little like that cigar engagement ring.
-Dad, stop. Seriously. -[phone vibrating]
Um, sorry, guys, one sec. I'll be right back.
Jake, you've gotta stop calling. No, I'm not gonna stop calling until we talk.
translation.ko: - 제이크, 전화 좀 그만해요 - 얘기할 때까지 계속 걸 거예요

translation.en: [Rachel] I don't want to do this. Okay? I…
So I'm gonna just hang up the phone now.
Please don't try to find me, okay?
Too late.
Why are you doing this?
Do you really have to ask?
I'm not coming out.
I'm not. I can't.
Why? Why not? What are you… What are you afraid of? What's gonna happen?
translation.ko: 왜요? 뭐가 두려워요? 어떻게 되는 건데요?

translation.en: Jake, you don't understand.
You don't. I have finally found something… that I can really…
I can really count on, and…
It may not be perfect, but it's what I want.
translation.ko: 완벽하진 않더라도 이게 내가 원하는 거예요

translation.en: It's what I need.
So I need you to understand that.
I do understand. I understand the whole thing.
I understand that…
what you may have needed before, you don't need anymore.
Look at me, I… All I wanted my entire life was to be alone.
translation.ko: 날 봐요, 평생 혼자 사는 삶을 추구했었죠

translation.en: And it's hard for people like us to trust, right? To let people in.
translation.ko: 우리 같은 사람은 신뢰가 어려워요 누군가를 받아들이기 힘들죠

translation.en: It's hard. I understand that. But here I am, right here, right now.
translation.ko: 힘들어요, 이해해요 하지만 여기 내가 지금 왔잖아요

translation.en: And I am standing here with the only friend I have in the entire world.
translation.ko: 전 세계에서 유일한 내 친구와 함께 서 있다고요

translation.en: I'm staring at the woman that I love,
and I'm begging you to trust me.
I'm telling you, you can trust me.
Just let me in, please.
Let me in.
Tell me
you don't love me.
Jake, that's Alan. You gotta go.
You tell me that you don't love me and I'll go.
I don't love you.
Saw your truck, thought we'd pop by and wish you Merry Christmas.
translation.ko: 네 트럭을 보고 메리 크리스마스 인사하러 들렀어

translation.en: Oh, thank you.
Yes, I was packing up a few things, then I need to lock up, and then take off, so…
translation.ko: 짐을 싸고 있었어요 문 잠그고 이제 가려고요

translation.en: Would you care to join us for dinner? We'd love to have you.
translation.ko: 같이 저녁 먹을래요? 오면 정말 좋겠는데

translation.en: We really would. We're having a few people over.
It's Christmas dinner, all the trimmings.
I would, I would love to, and thank you, but I should take off before the roads get too slick.
translation.ko: 가고 싶지만 길이 너무 미끄러워지기 전에 출발하려고요

translation.en: How did things go with your father?
Um, you know, they… Better than expected. Much better, actually.
translation.ko: 기대 이상이었어요 실은 진짜 매우 좋았죠

translation.en: -I told you. -You did.
And Rachel and her mom?
I think that's gonna work itself out.
That's very good news. Excellent.
Oh, bloody hell, I've gotta go baste the ham. You sure you can't stay?
translation.ko: 이런, 햄에 소스를 끼얹으러 가 봐야겠네요, 정말 안 올래요?

translation.en: Well, Happy Christmas, old boy.
-Happy basting. -[Ellie] I'll be right there.
Come on in.
And you and Rachel?
No? Really? I was so sure.
translation.ko: 안 됐어? 진짜? 좋은 느낌을 받았는데

translation.en: Well, Kerouac said it.
"It all ends in tears, anyway."
But I'll be okay, and Rachel will be okay too.
Of course.
Merry Christmas.
For me? What did you do here?
Oh, Ellie…
You put the… tree back in.
Yes.
I have wonderful memories of this house.
translation.ko: 난 이 집에 좋은 기억이 많아

translation.en: You and Benji playing in the yard.
Your folks.
Merry Christmas.
-Take care. -Oh, you too. Take care of yourself too.
And thank you. This is just… You're special.
translation.ko: 그리고 감사합니다 이건 정말, 아줌마는 특별해요
